column4: problems opening /etc/network/interfaces? anyone have any ideas?
I'm typing that into terminal to change ip address, it says "no such file or directory"
I went to the directory there is a file "interfaces_old" which I can't do anything with. I used that filename instead, to no avail
why can't you do anything with it
sorry yeah I meant interfaces. I right click it to change filename or something, it says root in the permissions tab and is greyed out
you need to launch the editor with gksudo before it, as it needs root permissions to open it
I don't have an interfaces folder to move it to, is this what you mean? I tried sudo, didn't work. when I use sudo, it kinda pauses, then just gives me a new command line
it's not a "folder" it's a file
I don't have an interfaces file, just interfaces_old
so move interfaces_old to be called interfaces
that's what I tried to do-the permissions tab is greyed out. I don't know how else to rename the file
you need to launch the editor with gksudo as I told you to get root permissions

sudo mv /etc/network/interfaces_old /etc/network/interfaces
2008-12-12T22:51:00.000Z	scoremeformusic	ikonia	nope, just gave me a new line
2008-12-12T22:52:00.000Z	ikonia	scoremeformusic	it's done it for you
2008-12-12T22:53:00.000Z	scoremeformusic	ikonia	(thanks) but it gives me this: mv: cannot stat `/etc/network/interfaces_old': No such file or directory
2008-12-12T22:53:00.000Z	ikonia	scoremeformusic	it's moved it for you !
2008-12-12T22:54:00.000Z	scoremeformusic	ikonia	sorry I misread what you wrote....thanks so much!
